title: On the other hand Bot-lane is a gank fiesta, too often determined by outside influences
body:
Here's a frustrating, yet common scenario for me.

One team overloads bot, gets a kill or 2 and takes the turret/dragon.

The other team decides to sit in lane/jg, grab 15 cs and take 1/3 of the tower before backing.

**Meanwhile the botlaners have no real options.** Stronger towers would grant a more reliable measure for dealing with this sort of thing. However we all know, that in their current state, turrets are often inadequately punishing aggressive (risky) plays during the laning phase.

 At the very least, the team that wants to abandon their lanes to force a win in bot should pay a higher opportunity cost.

Ooh! Ramping attack speed to punish those sloppy dives that so many people narrowly escape from. It still makes room for tower dives while punishing ones that weren't thought out at all.

Or we could just increase tower range, and make it safe to sit under tower. Make a trap free zone with reduced traps too, like the cait traps. We could give ally MS buff under tower, there are lots of things, and lots of things have been proposed to riot. I honestly don't think they give a fuck.

Maybe make it so getting turret agro makes you a target for it further away than it's normal range? 

In that I mean, say current turret agro range is 100 and a ranged champ hits someone from 95 range from the center of the turret. Currently this person would lose agro once they get to 101 range. My proposal is to make it so you keep agro until you get to 121 range.

So you'd still gain agro from the same range but you'd KEEP agro for a longer range. It would make dives riskier and make poking someone trying to hug their turret harder to do.

It already does this, it can fire several hundred range beyond its aggro radius, including over the walls in the jungle--provided you have vision there, and they aggro to their target first, before said target gets out into the wider range.

I wanna say they have 700-750 range and can keep aggro to almost 1,000? 

Edit: looked it up, and here you go.

Turrets initially had 700 range, which was later buffed to 750.

Additionally, they have a vision range of 1,095 *and can fire at targets they aggro on, up to the edge of their vision range, before switching to new targets* Note, try not to confuse their vision range with their stealth detection range, which is a flat 1,000.
Horrible suggestion extremly anti melee
That would be a great start.

Honestly I think this all comes down to ADC's. 
Make their items more expensive or weaker. Possibly a bit of both. Either would help. 
I think a slight buff to towers should also be in order.

######make it so first wave towers are buffed until someone gets the first turret. Then they go to regular stats. Possibly extend this to apply per wave. So second wave turrets are buffed until one team takes down a second wave turret. Or not; depending how the inital first buff affects the game all together. 

As someone who mostly plays mid or bot what I usually notice happens is bot lane gets a few ganks, a few kills, and then get their first item + boots while the enemy is still trying to get enough CS for a first item. Then winning bot lane get tower, takes drag, and/or brings it all to mid and then mid becomes a 5v5. 

Making it harder for ADC's to get their first items and/or having their items wielding less power will help extend the laning phase.
In mid lane being 5/0 means I have decent items and have my enemy laner playing passive / getting their jg to help more 
Being 5/0 in bot lane means I have the tower taken already and I'm laughing.

My current strategy as jungler is the always start at the top of the map and b-line to bot lane for a lvl 3 gank. On a big winstreak right now too. A successful bot gank is the early game equivalent of a baron.
Bot lane is the king, but the true power of bot lane comes from the one standing behind the throne which is all the other lanes.

Your team has the option of overloading bot as well. Just communicate with your team to do so and you'll probably find this strategy is helping you snowball games instead of getting mad that everybody is doing it to you. It's only an unfair part of the game if everybody can't utilize it equally.

Before, dragon wasn't an easy kill nor something that warped the game as much as it does now.  Nor was taking the first tower or snowballing your botlane.

Now all three of these things are the most reliable ways to win a game of League of Legends.
Damage is too high, so objectives and things like tower diving are too easy.

I think you're either willfully being ignorant here, or else you've simply forgotten how massively those elements, and the reward structures behind them, have changed in the last two years from how League was preseason 1 all the way through Season 5.
